objdescid.origination: Frederick Tatham author, inventor, delineator. Frederick Tatham wrote and signed this receipt.

provenance.name: Yale University Library
provenance.note: John Linnell; from the Linnell collection; sold at Christie's, Dec. 2, 1938 to the dealer W.H. Robinson on behalf on Otis T. Bradley (in Lot 62 £78 15s); presented to Yale University Library by Mr. Otis T. Bradley in 1941 or 1942.

repository.department: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

desc.objtitle:
18 May 1829 Receipt, John Linnell, 18 May 1829,
Object 1 (Bentley Receipt 45)

objnote.p: Frederick Tatham wrote and signed this receipt.

lg.l: Sixpence for Homers IliadKeynes (*Letters*, page 172) reads "sixpence" for "Sixpence".

&
Oddisy Odyssey –Bentley (*Blake Records*, page 778) and Keynes (*Letters*, page 172) read "Oddisy" but the word is obscured in the manuscript.
